acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 24 hours EC50=445mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (SIDS, 1998).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the testing data of rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 2,000mg/kg or more (SIDS (1998)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of dust/mist) of 1.71mg/L (SIDS, 1998).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 138mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 138mg/kg (SIDS (1998)) and 300mg/kg (SIDS (1998)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category D (not classifiable as to human carcinogenicity) by EPA (1991).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =80000mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#2205)

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests), described in CERI Hazard Data 2001-17 (2002) and SIDS (1998).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures; the auto-ignition temperature is 550degC (ICSC, 1999)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in CERI Hazard Data 2001-17 (2002) and ACGIH (7th, 2001), the results of rat reproductive toxicity and teratogenicity tests suggest no adverse effects on reproduction and development.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on the rabbit skin irritation tests, "irritating" (SIDS (1998)), "slight irritation" (HSDB (2001)), "slightly irritating" (IUCLID (2000)): "Mild"

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the testing data of rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-17, (2002) and ACGIH (7th, 2001)), suggesting that the substance "has no irritation" and "no irritation".

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Insufficient data available - very few test results have been reported with their details unknown, and no epidemiological data are available, though the results of guinea pig skin sensitization tests are all negative (CERI Hazard Data 2001-17 (2002), ACGIH (7th, 2001) and IUCLID (2000)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (adrenal gland, blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "hemolytic anemia, a decrease in white blood cell count" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), and the evidence from animal studies including "a decrease in mean corpuscular hemoglobin, hemoglobin concentrations, red blood cell count and hematocrit levels," and "adrenal degeneration" (MOE Risk Assessment Vol.3 (2004)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "tightness of the chest, headache, debility (being barely able to stand), cyanosis, tachycardia, tachypnea, hypotension, pupillary dilatation, intermittent tonic contraction of limb/facial muscles" (MOE Risk Assessment Vol.3 (2004)), and the evidence from animal studies including "convulsions, lethargy, salvation, stridor" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-17 (2002)). The effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
